title: Enterprise Backup & Disaster Recovery
description: This comprehensive module provides an in-depth exploration of enterprise backup strategies, restoration techniques, and disaster recovery planning. Participants will learn industry best practices, tools, and methodologies to ensure business continuity in the face of data loss, cyberattacks, and infrastructure failures.
content:
1. Introduction to Data Protection


1.1 Importance of Backup & Recovery

  • Business risks of data loss (financial, legal, reputational)
  • Real-world examples of catastrophic failures (e.g., ransomware attacks, natural disasters)
  • Compliance requirements (GDPR, HIPAA, SOX)


1.2 Key Terminology

  • RTO (Recovery Time Objective): Maximum acceptable downtime
  • RPO (Recovery Point Objective): Maximum acceptable data loss
  • MTD (Maximum Tolerable Downtime): Business impact threshold


2. Backup Strategies & Methodologies


2.1 The 3-2-1 Backup Rule & Beyond

  • 3 Copies (Primary + 2 backups)
  • 2 Different Media Types (e.g., Disk + Cloud)
  • 1 Offsite Copy (Geographically separated)
  • Advanced Variations: 3-2-1-1-0 (Immutable backups, zero errors)


2.2 Backup Types


﻿2.3 Backup Storage Media Comparison

  • Disk (NAS/SAN): Fast recovery, but vulnerable to on-site disasters
  • Tape: Cost-effective long-term storage, but slow retrieval
  • Cloud (AWS S3, Azure Blob): Scalable, but egress fees apply
  • Immutable Storage: Protects against ransomware


3. Disaster Recovery Planning


3.1 Developing a DR Plan

  • Step 1: Risk Assessment (Identify critical systems)
  • Step 2: Define RTO/RPO for each system
  • Step 3: Select DR strategies (Pilot Light, Warm Standby, Hot Site)
  • Step 4: Document procedures (Contact lists, escalation paths)


3.2 Disaster Recovery Tiers


3.3 Testing & Validation

  • Tabletop Exercises: Simulate disasters without execution
  • Partial Failover Tests: Validate critical systems
  • Full DR Drills: Annual full-scale tests


4. Enterprise Backup Solutions


4.1 On-Premises Tools

  • Veeam: Gold standard for virtualized environments
  • Commvault: AI-driven data management
  • Rubrik: Cloud-integrated appliance


4.2 Cloud & Hybrid Solutions

  • AWS Backup: Native integration with AWS services
  • Azure Site Recovery: Automated failover for Azure VMs
  • Druva: SaaS-based backup with global deduplication


﻿4.3 Emerging Technologies

  • Cyber Recovery Vaults: Air-gapped, immutable storage
  • DRaaS (Disaster Recovery as a Service): Fully managed failover

caseStudy.title: Ransomware Recovery
caseStudy.content: A financial firm’s accounting database was encrypted by ransomware. The last clean backup is 24 hours old, and payroll processing is due in 12 hours.

questions.question: How would you prioritize recovery to meet payroll deadlines?
questions.answer: Restore accounting systems first, use manual processing as a stopgap.

questions.question: What safeguards would you implement post-recovery?
questions.answer: Immutable backups, multi-person approval for critical changes.

quiz.question: Which backup type only saves changes since the last full backup?
What is the primary benefit of a "Hot Site"?
